proof:
Proof. For all $P \in \mathcal{P}$, by Lemma 3.1 on $H[P]$ and $d_{\text{remove}}$, there is a graph $R_P$ with degree $\le d_{\text{remove}}$ s.t. the maximum clique size in $H[P] - R_P$ is $\le 16 \ln(n) \frac{d_{\text{filter}}}{d_{\text{remove}}} + 10$.
We take $R := \bigcup_{P \in \mathcal{P}} R_P$. Since $Q$ is disjoint with all sets in $\mathcal{P}$, none of the edges in $R$ are incident to any vertex in $Q$. Additionally, for all $P \in \mathcal{P}$, since $R_P \subseteq R$ and the vertex sets in $\mathcal{P}$ are disjoint, we have $R_P = R[P]$. Thus, the largest clique in $(H - R)[P] = H[P] - R_P$ has size $\le 16 \ln(n) \frac{d_{\text{filter}}}{d_{\text{remove}}} + 10$.
